titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Charles W. Blake was born in Pleasantville, NJ. Blake worked for several U.S. shipping companies, including Clyde Steamship Co, USSB, CD Mallory & Co., and Callaghan, Atkinson, & Co. Comprise career (ca. 1906-1932) Some ships identified: Egremont, Swiftlight, Ambridge, Hugoton, Mallemak.

scopecontent.p: log of SS Teresa (1917); Chief Officer's Log Book, (1917) logbook of SS Hugoton; log of US Steam Launch Barancas (contains material from SS Teresa and SS Swiftarrow), 1909-1926; master reports for the SS Teresa; circulars and form letters from the War Department, regarding vessel appearance; assorted reports of public service for various vessels; payroll information for the SS Swiftarrow and SS Hugoton; transcription of telegram of hurricane warnings off coast of Florida and Nassau Island, 1926; account books for SS Bolagan, Red Cloud, and Lake Horkville (1918-19); account book for SS Bellepine (1921) and SS Swiftstar; statements of expenses aboard the SS Red Cloud, submitted to Callaghan, Atkinson & Co.; and payroll lists/balance sheets. Other papers in the collection include: telegrams, correspondence, invoices, notes by Capt. Blake; reports on voyages addressed to owners; disbound scrapbook with clippings and ephemera (1906-1926); transcriptions of news dispatches (1917)

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
